title: Two minors detained for anti-India activities, booked under UAPA
text:
“Such individuals will be identified in Raipur and other major cities of Chhattisgarh and action will be taken against them. I will also request the Chief Minister to expand the ATS team,” the home minister added.

The Anti-Terrorism Squad (ATS) in Chhattisgarh has detained two minors and booked them under the provisions of the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act (UAPA) for their alleged links with an ISIS module online. The two were allegedly influencing others to spread extremist propaganda using fake social media handles.

Confirming the development on Tuesday, Home Minister Vijay Sharma said, “ATS Chhattisgarh has got a major success. Two minors from Raipur were in touch (online) with an ISIS group. The two were working on the directions of a Pakistan-based module. The two were active on social media and were influencing others using fake Instagram IDs.”
